title: Video: MONEY – Goodnight London / The Sound Of The Death Of Everything (La Blogotheque)
body:
This was a collaboration just waiting to happen; Manchester pioneer’s **MONEY** hooking up with French website [La Blogotheque](http://www.blogotheque.net/2012/10/02/money/). Their ‘takeaway’ shows set in niche setting are now a staple part of independent music, and are a sure sign of when a band is on the edge of greatness, certainly the case with **MONEY**. Filmed during this years The Great Escape festival in Brighton, and including a rendition of the stunning _Goodnight London_, played out on a well-worn piano in a quirky pub surrounded by locals swigging real ale, it’s the ideal setting for **MONEY’s** all-too-real imagery and emotional desolation.

Opening with a vocal only rendition of **Bob Dylan’s** _Mr. Tambourine Man_, it’s an encapsulating seven minutes, drawing the listener in before overwhelming with the sheer beauteous nature of the track. As the final notes of _Goodnight London_ ring out, the ever present squawk of seagulls can be heard overheard, followed by **Jamie’s** child-like laughter; perfectly echoing the innocence and fragility of their music. Check out the video below, as well as an original poem by Jamie, entitled _The Sound Of The Death Of Everything_.
